codeSystems.name: CDAActClass
codeSystems.title: CDAActClass
codeSystems.description: A code specifying the major type of Act that this Act-instance represents.

codeSystems.name: CDAActMood
codeSystems.title: CDAActMood
codeSystems.description: A code distinguishing whether an Act is conceived of as a factual statement or in some other manner as a command, possibility, goal, etc.

codeSystems.name: CDAActRelationshipType
codeSystems.title: CDAActRelationshipType
codeSystems.description: A code specifying the meaning and purpose of every ActRelationship instance. Each of its values implies specific constraints to what kinds of Act objects can be related and in which way.

codeSystems.name: CDAContextControl
codeSystems.title: CDAContextControl
codeSystems.description: A code that specifies how an ActRelationship or Participation contributes to the context of an Act, and whether it may be propagated to descendent Acts whose association allows such propagation.

codeSystems.name: CDAEntityNameUse
codeSystems.title: CDAEntityNameUse
codeSystems.description: A set of codes advising a system or user which name in a set of names to select for a given purpose - limited to values allowed in original CDA definition

codeSystems.name: CDANullFlavor
codeSystems.title: CDANullFlavor
codeSystems.description: CDA NullFlavors - limited to values allowed in original CDA definition

codeSystems.name: CDAParticipationType
codeSystems.title: CDAParticipationType
codeSystems.description: A code specifying the meaning and purpose of every Participation instance. Each of its values implies specific constraints on the Roles undertaking the participation. Limited to values allowed in original CDA definition

codeSystems.name: CDARoleClassAssociative
codeSystems.title: CDARoleClassAssociative
codeSystems.description: A general association between two entities that is neither partitive nor ontological.

codeSystems.name: CDARoleCode
codeSystems.title: CDARoleCode
codeSystems.description: A set of codes further specifying the kind of Role; specific classification codes for further qualifying RoleClass codes.

codeSystems.name: CDASignatureCode
codeSystems.title: CDASignatureCode
codeSystems.description:
A set of codes specifying whether and how the participant has attested his participation through a signature - limited to values allowed in original CDA definition.

**Note:** CDA Release One represented either an intended (`X`) or actual (`S`) authenticator. CDA Release Two only represents an actual authenticator, so has deprecated the value of `X`.

codeSystems.name: ActRelationshipAuthorizedBy
codeSystems.title: ActRelationshipAuthorizedBy
codeSystems.description: A relationship in which the target act authorizes or certifies the source act.

codeSystems.name: ActRelationshipFulfills
codeSystems.title: ActRelationshipFulfills
codeSystems.description: The source act fulfills (in whole or in part) the target act. Source act must be in a mood equal or more actual than the target act.

codeSystems.name: ActRelationshipHasComponent
codeSystems.title: ActRelationshipHasComponent
codeSystems.description: A collection of sub-services as steps or subtasks performed for the source service. Services may be performed sequentially or concurrently.

codeSystems.name: AdministrativeGender
codeSystems.title: AdministrativeGender
codeSystems.description: The gender of a person used for adminstrative purposes (as opposed to clinical gender)

codeSystems.name: EntityClassLivingSubject
codeSystems.title: EntityClassLivingSubject
codeSystems.description: Anything that essentially has the property of life, independent of current state (a dead human corpse is still essentially a living subject.)

codeSystems.name: EntityDeterminer
codeSystems.title: EntityDeterminer
codeSystems.description: EntityDeterminer in natural language grammar is the class of words that comprises articles, demonstrative pronouns, and quantifiers. In the RIM, determiner is a structural code in the Entity class to distinguish whether any given Entity object stands for some, any one, or a specific thing.

codeSystems.name: Ethnicity
codeSystems.title: Ethnicity
codeSystems.description: In the United States, federal standards for classifying data on ethnicity determine the categories used by federal agencies and exert a strong influence on categorization by state and local agencies and private sector organizations. The federal standards do not conceptually define ethnicity, and they recognize the absence of an anthropological or scientific basis for ethnicity classification. Instead, the federal standards acknowledge that ethnicity is a social-political construct in which an individual's own identification with a particular ethnicity is preferred to observer identification. The standards specify two minimum ethnicity categories: Hispanic or Latino, and Not Hispanic or Latino. The standards define a Hispanic or Latino as a person of "Mexican, Puerto Rican, Cuban, South or Central America, or other Spanish culture or origin, regardless of race." The standards stipulate that ethnicity data need not be limited to the two minimum categories, but any expansion must be collapsible to those categories. In addition, the standards stipulate that an individual can be Hispanic or Latino or can be Not Hispanic or Latino, but cannot be both.

codeSystems.name: MaritalStatus
codeSystems.title: MaritalStatus
codeSystems.description:
The domestic partnership status of a person.

*Example:*Married, separated, divorced, widowed, common-law marriage.

codeSystems.name: Race
codeSystems.title: Race
codeSystems.description: In the United States, federal standards for classifying data on race determine the categories used by federal agencies and exert a strong influence on categorization by state and local agencies and private sector organizations. The federal standards do not conceptually define race, and they recognize the absence of an anthropological or scientific basis for racial classification. Instead, the federal standards acknowledge that race is a social-political construct in which an individual's own identification with one more race categories is preferred to observer identification. The standards use a variety of features to define five minimum race categories. Among these features are descent from "the original peoples" of a specified region or nation. The minimum race categories are American Indian or Alaska Native, Asian, Black or African American, Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander, and White. The federal standards stipulate that race data need not be limited to the five minimum categories, but any expansion must be collapsible to those categories.

codeSystems.name: ReligiousAffiliation
codeSystems.title: ReligiousAffiliation
codeSystems.description: Assigment of spiritual faith affiliation

codeSystems.name: RoleClassAssignedEntity
codeSystems.title: RoleClassAssignedEntity
codeSystems.description: An agent role in which the agent is an Entity acting in the employ of an organization. The focus is on functional role on behalf of the organization, unlike the Employee role where the focus is on the 'Human Resources' relationship between the employee and the organization.

codeSystems.name: RoleClassRelationshipFormal
codeSystems.title: RoleClassRelationshipFormal
codeSystems.description: A relationship between two entities that is formally recognized, frequently by a contract or similar agreement.

codeSystems.name: XActRelationshipDocument
codeSystems.title: x_ActRelationshipDocument
codeSystems.description: Used to enumerate the relationships between two clinical documents for document management.

codeSystems.name: XInformationRecipient
codeSystems.title: x_InformationRecipient
codeSystems.description: Used to represent participant(s) who should receive a copy of a document.

codeSystems.name: XServiceEventPerformer
codeSystems.title: x_ServiceEventPerformer
codeSystems.description: Clones using this x\_domain should have a name "performer".

codeSystems.name: TRER260HL7RoleClassVS
codeSystems.title: TRE_R260-HL7RoleClass
codeSystems.description: TRE_R260-HL7RoleClass

codeSystems.name: JDV_J11-RelationPatient-CISIS
codeSystems.description: Relation par rapport au patient - CI-SIS

codeSystems.name: JDV_J47-FunctionCode-CISIS
codeSystems.description: Jeux de valeurs des RÃ´les fonctionnels HL7 et CI-SIS
